comment: Quiz and discussion post every week. Quizzes and tests don't use lockdown. Fairly easy class, just a lot of writing, and she's very rude in emails. Don't ask for extensions.

Professor Jordan is very clear in her instructions and what she expects from students as they complete their assignments. However, make sure to take good notes on any information/lectures in the weekly modules!! She is very firm on deadlines, which means that modules close at 12am on the final day (Sunday). Unfortunately, this includes lectures!!

This professor is clear from the start about what she wants. Her weekly quizzes were extremely easy, I got 100's on almost all of them, no lockdown. The other assignments have clear written and video instructions that need to be reviewed. If you review them, you'd get a good grade. She is great, I'd take her again.

All things considered, this was an easy online class. She is not quick on grading, so don't expect to get grades back for up to weeks after completing an assignment. Doesn't give great feedback but is not a tough grader. Her lectures were good! Would take again.

She was a good online teacher, only 3 major assignments, a quiz and discussion post every week but they were very easy. Only 2 tests but also pretty easy. You don't have to think too much, very easy. I give a 4 just because she's a little boring.

This is my 2nd time taking her (Mass Communication before) so I really do like her as a professor! For Communication Ethics class, we had discussion posts on outside material, short easy quizzes, and a weekly video! I don't recall needing a textbook. She's stern but fair!

Prof. Jordan's class is pretty easy and straightforward. Weekly notes, discussion post + response, and quiz with an assignment every 3 weeks or so (which is usually easy). Work for this class never took me more than an hour. She's kinda hard on deadlines, but you should be fine as the workload isn't a lot.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: 10/10 Recommend taking Professor Jordan. She is a sweet lady with impressive life experiences and accomplishments. I took Ethics, Law and Diversity online and it was very easy. There are short lectures each week, a discussion, web links, and sometimes few question quizzes. She gives very clear instructions for assignments and there were only 3.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This class is so easy . She makes everything clear , so it's no reason you should be behind . The work load is so light so its impossible to fall behind honestly . Extra credit opportunities , 11 discussion post ( easy money ) , 10 quizzes ( light work ) , 4 test ( so easy ) , and your final exam . She is the best . EASY A . Take her if you can

This class is so easy . She makes everything clear , so it's no reason you should be behind . The work load is so light so its impossible to fall behind honestly . Extra credit opportunities , 11 discussion post ( easy money ) , 10 quizzes ( light work ) , 4 test ( so easy ) , and your final exam . She is the best . EASY A . Take her if you can :)
SHe was pretty average at teaching but the class was pretty easy. I definitely would not necessarily recommend her, but I also would not warn against her.

The only thing I have say is do your best on the assignments! Other than that, she was a wonderful professor to have! The criteria that she offers was so inspiring and very beneficial to you for future use. Her discussions and quizzes are easy, and she offers extra credit! She diligently takes her time on lectures and explains them very thoroughly.

This class was overall super easy but she lowkey made it more difficult than it had to be. Tests/quizzes/discussions are easy, but she takes forever to grade assignments. If ur taking this class online: save ALL the info!! she closes every module and will NOT reopen them even though she bases future assignments on past modules????
It was a quiz and discussion each week, 4 tests + a final. The lectures make the material very easy to understand, overall this class was an easy A. She'll actually answer your email too.
Easy class but the professor made it harder than it had to be.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I always have mixed feelings when it comes to online courses but this professor made it so easy and understandable. Some professors on online courses will leave you alone but not this one! She cares so much there are several project and it seems hand on when it's online, she provides video lectures which shows that she is putting an extra effort.
Very straight forward class. It's not very challenging. Take it.

Easy class, but she takes FOREVER to grade things. Four tests were taken directly from study guides. Three mini-papers and about 10 discussions. Nothing is hard except waiting months for the grade. No text is required, everything is in PowerPoint and outside links. A lot is a rehash of things from previous MENT/COM classes.

Jeannette's class is straightforward and fairly easy if you do the work. She is informative and her lectures are pretty interesting. My only real gripe is that she can be very passive-aggressive at times. This could be mostly due to it being online and it is hard to read her tone. Otherwise, she's a good professor and I recommend her.

Super easy class. Made As on all tests and quizzes using Quizzlet. Don't waste your $ on the textbook! Weekly discussion aren't bad. Fairly quick grader, although little feedback is given. She drops the lowest discussion and quiz scores. Extra credit opportunity, but you shouldn't need it if you do all the work. Take her for this class.
Professor Jordan is really sweet.

Honestly this was a class with decent workload and the work isnt hard. Discussion post every week aside from test weeks. She does allow extra credit, I would prefer to take her online the major con is she grades extremely slow! Some of grades from mid semester still not graded & grades are due to registrar in 3 days.

Weekly quizzes and discussion posts. Overall not a difficult class, very well laid out and clear grading structure, and she did provide an extra credit opportunity as well. As long as you do your work on time you'll get an A.

As long as you turn something in, you will be completely fine!! The whole semester consisted of a weekly discussion post that took 20 mins MAX, 3 assignments (Law/Ethics/Diversity) that took 1 hour each & tests were simple multiple choice. I highly recommend this class if you don't like to read a lot, have other difficult classes, or work a lot.

I took Professor Jordan's class online during the summer and I wouldn't have passed if I didn't read the textbook, but that's just me so I read a lot. We had weekly discussion posts, quizzes, and five tests. They weren't the hardest since they were open book, but they were pretty random fact-based questions from the text. Overall not too hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I took professor Jordan during the summer for Intro to Mass Comm. This was probably the easiest class to be honest. You do need the textbook, however I did not read the chapters lol. Just have it open when taking quizzes and search the key words on the quiz. Discussion Post are easy as well.

You'll pass her class if you do things on time. Better than some Intently on being heard Totally professional Constantly tells you what she has already said, assuming everyone is against her Has to be done her way

Took her online for Spring '21 and SUPER easy. there was rarely any work outside of a simple discussion post every week. We had 3 small assignments (1 page papers) throughout the course that was super simple. The final was a quiz that was easy + also accessible on quizlet and she gave plenty extra credit opportunities. Definitely take her. Easy A!

Took her last semester and loved her so I took her again. Something changed. A once friendly, positive professor became rude and overall frustrating to deal with. No rubrics on projects, so youll miss points for things you didnt know you needed to do. Plus 20+ page study guide for the final. Very dissapointing, not sure what changed.

Easiest online class plus she is so nice and caring! Class consists of weekly discussions, quizzes and a few tests. EVERYTHING IS ON QUIZLET and all tests and quizzes aren't lockdown browser, she actually allowed open note. She really cares about her students and is very clear on her expectations. Take her!

Do not take this professor if you can avoid it. Uses other professor's lectures. This course lacks substance and runs off YouTube. Take someone else's course who provides a quality class without just trying to get by. Be ready to show up and read enormous amounts of text while trying to navigate the poor online format. Tons of homework too!

Easy class. Only weekly discussion posts, three projects and a final. Plenty of extra credit to go around. Solid choice. She is very positive. She had trouble with D2L at first, but after the first few weeks it got sorted out. No reason not to take her really if shes available.

Professor Jordan is a great choice. She is a little slow at responding to emails, but you shouldnt need to email her too much anyway the class setup is very straightforward with a minimal workload. She offers plenty of extra credit, but you shouldnt have to use it unless you missed a quiz or discussion. Also extends deadlines often!
Easiest A ever! Straight forward with instructions and easy grader. Just do the assignments correctly and you should get a 100 on everything.
super light course load, 1 discussion and 1 quiz every week. easy and lenient grader!! definitely take her. she is super sweet and really cares about you.
Took online cause covid and would highly recommend online! A quiz and discussion every week and 4 tests. Interesting book and subject! Easy A!

Took this class online. This professor gives little to no instruction on assignments, is very rude when asked questions, and just genuinely doesn't seem willing to help students ever. They will post an assignment and then provide three different sets of instructions that are all different and you're just supposed to figure it out. 0/10 experience

She will never answer her email. Her only grades are an almosty weekly discussion post and 3 concept maps. She has a final at the end which originally was going to be another concept map but she changed it to a final test. She grades pretty easily but never expect an answer back on any questions you have. I haven't learned anything from this class.

discussion and quiz every week, 4 tests and a final. (quizlet will be your BFF). She seemed a little unorganized at first, but she has been awesome. This course was so easy. Dont even consider another professor!! 10000% recommend her!!!

This was one of my favorite classes of the semester. She knows the subject and is really funny and makes the subject interesting. She also has an amazing spirit and is very nice. I would for sure take her again!

Take her! She is so nice and is very flexible. There is no midterm or final just 4 tests, a few discussions, and a group project. Don't buy the book because everything comes from her powerpoints and there is a free pdf copy offered through the library. She is very worldly and is the perfect lady to teach this class.

This class had a manageable amount of work per week. The discussions were very easy, but the quizzes and tests could be challenging at times. Professor Jordan is very hard to get in touch with. You never know if she will reply to your email or not. She doesn't seem to be very aware if there is a mistake within the module or a mistake on a test.

This was the easiest online class I have ever taken. There is a 10 question quiz and a discussion post due every week but the discussions are super easy and she doesn't use lockdown browser for any of the tests or quizzes. The material is interesting. You do not need the textbook. Overall would recommend this class, super easy A.

Pretty fun content to learn about, with a professor that seems to enjoy sharing said content with the class. Took a lot of pieces of information I knew beforehand and neatly tied them together in interesting ways. If you need a class to round out your schedule for whatever reason, this one's a great one.

Easiest online class Ive ever taken in life! She will respond to your emails in about 24 hours! I dont know why her rating is so low? Maybe in a regular class its more difficult but if you take online, EVERYTHING is on quizlet! No lockdown browser, and gives you more than enough time to take the test! Extra credit given out twice! Take her! Easy
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: ok, so I found it fine taking this class online, no the teacher is not too active but it is an online class everything you need to know it right in front of you. textbook wise it was only used twice for two big assignment so I suppose you should have it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many

comment: We had 4 tests, 1 group project, and 2 extra credit quizzes. The tests were worth 25 points each, and the project was 100 points, so do well on the project. The tests are comprised of true/false, multiple choice, and fill in the blank, with each test's difficulty increasing as the semester progressed.

The class is very easy, I enjoyed it. Not much to do in the class so it will not be overwhelming. I enjoyed her class so far! I also had a health issue this year, not only was she understanding but helped me manage my schedule during my surgery so I would not be behind. Take if if you can!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's okay. Not great, not terrible. Her tests start out easy then get really hard. I got a 100 on the first one, 92 on the second one, 76 on the third. She can get boring and really technical when it comes to exams so you have to have the exact right answer or she'll mark it wrong, even if she knew what you meant.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Like with many of the other comments on here, she's just right down the middle mediocre. Nice lady, has lots of experience in the field, but has no idea how to teach or convey the material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very nice lady. Lectures are really boring. Quizzes are straight from the Powerpoint. Tests are from the book and powerpoints. She grades the last paper extremely harshly. Try to do well on all of the other assignments so the paper wont hurt your grade as much. I failed the paper but still managed to get an A. She also gives a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She was alright. Lectures and book were easy to understand, quizzes were easy, and the tests were fine. Easy group project as well, but be careful who you work with. We had a problem person in my group and the prof was not very helpful when we reported it. Hardest part is the paper, which she does grade harshly. But she offers good extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Lectures may be boring but the content you need for tests comes straight off the PowerPoint. Some people had issues with her paper but only because shes expects more than most people are willing to put in for an "elective." But she's the only one who teaches this course. With all the extra credit offered I ended up making over a 100 in the course.

This woman is a contradiction of herself. Laid back one minute, harsh grader the next. Mandatory attendence. 1 paper that is extremely difficult to pass. Very few assignments, so if you fail one and don't get 100s on the others, you fail the class, even if most of your grades are As and Bs. She gives extra credit, but it's one point here and there.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took  this class online. Professor Jordan was hands off and not involved with the course. She facilitated some discussions and gave a few extra credit opportunities. I do not suggest taking this course online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--TEST HEAVY

comment: I wouldn't take this class again because her lectures are boring . We watched a couple of videos but that's it. No type of hands on learning and overall nobody was interested. The online quizzes that are pretty easy if you read the book. The quizzes didn't have any material from the notes. The tests were worded poorly/ no material from notes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not a very exciting class but it was an easy A. There is only one homework assignment, everything else is just reading, tests, and quizzes. If you want an easy class I would suggest this professor.

Very sweet lady, and open to all questions, but she's just got no energy and it's hard to pay attention to her, especially since it's a class that allows laptops. I mean, if she was the last option for a class, I would take her, but she's not my first choice.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She really cares about her students. She is such a sweetheart! She isn't the best lecturer, but she does try to give real world examples. I took her over the summer and it wasn't too intensive at all. Warning: there is a 30 minute presentation, but it isn't bad AT ALL. 1 quiz over the book, 3 over lecture, but you don't really need the book.

If you show up to class, take good notes and do well on your group project, this class is an easy A! Attendance was mandatory and essential to getting the notes because she didn't post materials on D2L. All quizzes and exams were online, so they were easy to pass. The textbook was helpful but not necessary like she said. Extra credit offered!

Major attitude problems and makes you feel like you're not good enough to graduate! Sadly, I'd take her again though because all quizzes and test are online. Make sure to write down each PowerPoint slide because she doesn't post them (she's trying to sell them for some odd reason) Also, she takes attendance every single class.
Professor Jordan is hilarious! She's very experienced in the field of communication, and her class is so easy. Everything is online, and quizlet has the majority of the answers. Take her!

She is the most boring professor at KSU. Not inspirational at all. I love reporting and writing but she made it so boring and painful I dreaded that class. Her "lectures" are her reading a ppt. Takes attendance for points. Only positive is she offers extra credit and tests/quizzes are relatively easy. Definitely would NOT recommend or take again.

Textbook is needed for the quizzes / tests. DON'T read it, SKIM it. The ONLINE tests & quizzes primarily consists of her ppts & a few one-liner definitions from the textbook. Show up. Type out her ppts. Organize your notes. You're good. Easy A in exchange for a boring lecture.

oh, jeannette. i had high hopes for her early in the semester but have lost all hope. she is god awful. spends all class reading from the powerpoints which she doesnt post online, tests and quizzes are from the book and attendance is mandatory. group project, 5 page paper she doesnt explain. but have fun, shes the only one who teaches this class.

This was the WORST professor I have had at Kennesaw State. I often find myself questioning if she really knows what she is talking about. She says that her class is all about getting "real world experience" and "understanding" but gives quizzes asking for direct quotes from the book. We all failed the quiz and she made no changes. DO NOT TAKE HER!
Her class was mandatory and one of the most boring I have ever sat through, but it is an easy class.

Found myself constantly in the dark as to whether she really knew what she was talking about and the lectures drag on because she just reads from the powerpoint. HOWEVER, you would probably have to try to not get an A in this class. Multiple unneeded extra credit opportunities, 2 online at home tests, and 2 assignments and that's it. Easy A.

Prof. Jordan is absolutely awesome! I'm taking her now. She's funny. Test & quizzes are easy. All multiple choice. No longer a 6-8 page paper, instead an easy, fun group project as well. Another group project for country media systems. Show up to class to write the notes because she doesn't post them on D2L. She's inspirational and a joy.

Class can usually be boring because she just goes over slides, but it's important to go because she takes attendance and doesn't post lectures online.  She doesn't provide much help with the assignments, she just expects you to know how to do them.  Other than that, I enjoy her class because she's pretty funny.  I would take another class wher.
Easy A. Literally, all that matters. Numerous extra credit opportunities even though you really won't need the extra credit. You wouldn't not get an A even if you tried.

Super nice lady with real world COM experience. She does her best to prepare you for a career in the real world. Subject matter is pretty dry, but she tries her best to make it interesting. The book is inexpensive and reads like a novel. One paper and one group project. Pop quizzes that aren't so "pop"... she gives plenty of warning.

Offers insane amounts of extra credit. Tests are all online, same with quizzes. Take notes and have your book available and you should make a 100% on almost all of them. 2 assignments and they were lengthy but not hard. Very boring and not very helpful. Easy A.
Classes are powerpoint lectures, but don't miss class because all the notes will get you an A on every test and quiz. Questions and answers come straight from the powerpoints. Easy A!!

Professor Jordan is extremely nice. She is a new but knowledgable. My class was crazy loud and disrespectful but she did not return that to anyone. She is willing to do anything to help you get an A even bonus coupons worth 5 points.

The class is easy. She gives exact exam questions, but absolutely useless if you want to learn anything. She's not knowledgeable at all. Her power points often had things in them that were false. Things that could be proven wrong with a Google search. When people called her on it, she denied it. Don't ask questions, just be quiet and ace the class.

Ms. Jordan is an awesome teacher take her if you can! She gives you the exact test questions and allows you and classmates to share answers. Her test aren't easy but she gives you the questions. Shes caring and will help you. Shes a new teacher but has experience and knowledgeable. This is a class that you won't have to stress about! TAKE HER
